wikipedia_page.main: Michael Julien (a.k.a. Peter Warne; 1 August 1927 – 29 December 2020) was a British songwriter, who was the co-writer of a number of hit songs around the world. He co-wrote the winning song at the 1969 Eurovision Song Contest and received an Ivor Novello Award for songwriting.

response: |"Let's Live for Today" – The Grass Roots|| ||w.m. David Shapiro and Mogol, translated w. Michael Julien
